snakespit

Hey all. Thinking about getting a new acoustic (6 string steel). I want to spend $1000 or less...any ideas? 
 
 I am currently looking at:
 
 Epiphone Masterbuilt EF500-RA
 Breedlove Atlas AD20/SR Plus
 Seagull Artist Mosaic Folk
 Gibson DSR
 
 Anyone know anything about these particular guitars that could help me to decide? I have played them all and find them to be pretty equal in sound. People tell me that the Epi will come in a little better in sounds as it ages. 
 
 That or any other suggestions that you think I should consider. I am mostly into fingerpicking, and play a good bit of folk, classic rock, bluegrass, and blues.
isly ilwott

 If I had 3K+ to spend...it would be for this:
 
 http://www.taylorguitars.com/Guitars/Acoustic/810-910/910/
 
 But seriously...I thought we had more guitar players than just me. Thoughts...anyone?
Jim Colyer
A guitar is like a woman. There has to be a perfect fit.
isly ilwott

A guitar is like a woman. There has to be a perfect fit.
...and only when you play with them do they make those pleasing sounds. Unlike a woman, when one stops playing, it shuts up.
isly ilwott

If I had 3K+ to spend...it would be for this:
 
 http://www.taylorguitars.com/Guitars/Acoustic/810-910/910/
 
 But seriously...I thought we had more guitar players than just me. Thoughts...anyone?
Another excellent choice. My hubby plays. He has a friend that has handmade one guitar that sounds like it should cost tens of thousands of dollars. This friend's favorite guitar is a Taylor.
 
 The choice of woods and the thicknesses of the pieces are crucial in determining the quality of the tone.
Chuz Life

If I had 3K+ to spend...it would be for this:
 
 Taylor Guitars ? Model 910
 
 But seriously...I thought we had more guitar players than just me. Thoughts...anyone?

 
 I play electric. (American Strat, Guild Starfive IV, Tele) But I have a cheap "Sigma" accoustic (knockoff of a Martin) that plays and sounds like most Martins I've sampled.
 
 What did you end up with, Snake?
snakespit

Ended up with a Taylor 210e. It sounded as good if not better than most others I had played, and I got a great deal on it. I have since changed the saddle and nut to fossilised walrus ivory, and have walrus ivory pins on order. I think I might also change the tuners. The factory tuners are ok, I just want to put in locking tuners with a higher ratio.
Chuz Life

 You're not a "Blues man" are ya?
 
 Bluz-caster!
snakespit

You're not a "Blues man" are ya?
 
 Bluz-caster!

 
 Not in the Stevie Ray Vaughan sense of blues, not even close. I love Stevie and his music, but I am just not into playing electric. I play more traditional blues...Robert Johnson, Blind Lemon Jefferson...Delta Blues kinda stuff.
